input.content:
#!/bin/bash
# NGC-Optimized Post-Install Script for OVH Cloud L4-360 GPUs
# ===========================================================
#
# This script sets up NVIDIA GPU Cloud (NGC) environment on OVH Cloud
# specifically for L4-360 Tesla GPUs with proper CUDA configuration
#
# Usage: ./ngc_post_install.sh
# Requirements: Ubuntu 20.04/22.04, root access

set -euo pipefail

# Configuration
SCRIPT_VERSION="1.0.0"
LOG_FILE="/var/log/ngc_post_install.log"
NGC_CLI_VERSION="3.41.4"
DOCKER_VERSION="24.0.7"
NVIDIA_DRIVER_VERSION="535"
CUDA_VERSION="12.2"

# Logging function
log() {
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
}

# Error handling
error_exit() {
    log "ERROR: $1"
    exit 1
}

log "Starting NGC Post-Install Script v${SCRIPT_VERSION}"
log "Target: OVH Cloud L4-360 GPU instances"
log "Environment: NVIDIA GPU Cloud (NGC)"

# Check if running as root
if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
   error_exit "This script must be run as root (use sudo)"
fi

# System information
log "System Information:"
log "OS: $(lsb_release -d | cut -f2)"
log "Kernel: $(uname -r)"
log "Architecture: $(uname -m)"

# Update system packages
log "Updating system packages..."
apt update -y
apt upgrade -y
apt install -y \
    curl \
    wget \
    gnupg2 \
    software-properties-common \
    apt-transport-https \
    ca-certificates \
    lsb-release \
    jq \
    htop \
    nvtop \
    git \
    python3 \
    python3-pip \
    unzip

# Install NVIDIA drivers for L4-360
log "Installing NVIDIA drivers (version ${NVIDIA_DRIVER_VERSION})..."
if ! command -v nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
    log "Installing NVIDIA driver ${NVIDIA_DRIVER_VERSION}..."
    
    # Add NVIDIA driver repository
    wget -qO - https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu2004/x86_64/3bf863cc.pub | apt-key add -
    echo "deb https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu2004/x86_64 /" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nvidia-cuda.list
    
    apt update -y
    
    # Install specific driver version for L4-360 compatibility
    apt install -y nvidia-driver-${NVIDIA_DRIVER_VERSION}
    apt install -y nvidia-utils-${NVIDIA_DRIVER_VERSION}
else
    log "NVIDIA drivers already installed: $(nvidia-smi --version | head -n 1)"
fi

# Install CUDA Toolkit
log "Installing CUDA Toolkit ${CUDA_VERSION}..."
if ! command -v nvcc &> /dev/null; then
    wget https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu2004/x86_64/cuda-keyring_1.0-1_all.deb
    dpkg -i cuda-keyring_1.0-1_all.deb
    apt update -y
    apt install -y cuda-toolkit-12-2
    
    # Set CUDA environment variables
    echo 'export PATH=/usr/local/cuda/bin:$PATH' >> /etc/environment
    echo 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH' >> /etc/environment
    echo 'export CUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda' >> /etc/environment
    
    source /etc/environment
else
    log "CUDA already installed: $(nvcc --version | grep release)"
fi

# Install Docker with NVIDIA Container Runtime
log "Installing Docker with NVIDIA Container Runtime..."
if ! command -v docker &> /dev/null; then
    # Install Docker
    curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg
    echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu $(lsb_release -cs) stable" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list
    
    apt update -y
    apt install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin
    
    # Enable Docker service
    systemctl enable docker
    systemctl start docker
    
    # Add current user to docker group (if not root)
    if [[ $SUDO_USER ]]; then
        usermod -aG docker $SUDO_USER
        log "Added $SUDO_USER to docker group"
    fi
else
    log "Docker already installed: $(docker --version)"
fi

# Install NVIDIA Container Toolkit
log "Installing NVIDIA Container Toolkit..."
if ! command -v nvidia-container-runtime &> /dev/null; then
    distribution=$(. /etc/os-release;echo $ID$VERSION_ID) \
        && curl -fsSL https://nvidia.github.io/libnvidia-container/gpgkey | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/nvidia-container-toolkit-keyring.gpg \
        && curl -s -L https://nvidia.github.io/libnvidia-container/$distribution/libnvidia-container.list | \
            sed 's#deb https://#deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/nvidia-container-toolkit-keyring.gpg] https://#g' > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nvidia-container-toolkit.list
    
    apt update -y
    apt install -y nvidia-container-toolkit
    
    # Configure Docker to use NVIDIA runtime
    nvidia-ctk runtime configure --runtime=docker
    systemctl restart docker
else
    log "NVIDIA Container Toolkit already installed"
fi

# Install NGC CLI
log "Installing NGC CLI v${NGC_CLI_VERSION}..."
if ! command -v ngc &> /dev/null; then
    cd /tmp
    wget -O ngccli_linux.zip "https://api.ngc.nvidia.com/v2/resources/nvidia/ngc-apps/ngc_cli/versions/${NGC_CLI_VERSION}/files/ngccli_linux.zip"
    unzip ngccli_linux.zip
    chmod u+x ngc-cli/ngc
    mv ngc-cli/ngc /usr/local/bin/
    rm -rf ngc-cli ngccli_linux.zip
    
    log "NGC CLI installed successfully"
else
    log "NGC CLI already installed: $(ngc version)"
fi

# Configure NGC (requires manual API key setup)
log "NGC CLI installed. Configure with: ngc config set"

# Install additional Python packages for ML workloads
log "Installing Python packages for ML workloads..."
pip3 install --upgrade pip
pip3 install \
    torch \
    torchvision \
    torchaudio \
    transformers \
    accelerate \
    bitsandbytes \
    vllm \
    flash-attn \
    numpy \
    pandas \
    jupyter \
    tensorboard

# Create working directories
log "Creating working directories..."
mkdir -p /opt/ngc/{models,data,logs,scripts}
mkdir -p /var/log/gpu-monitoring
chown -R $SUDO_USER:$SUDO_USER /opt/ngc 2>/dev/null || true

# Install GPU monitoring tools
log "Setting up GPU monitoring tools..."
cat > /usr/local/bin/gpu-monitor.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# GPU Monitoring Script for NGC Containers
while true; do
    timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    
    # Get GPU information
    if command -v nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
        nvidia-smi --query-gpu=timestamp,index,name,temperature.gpu,utilization.gpu,memory.used,memory.total,power.draw --format=csv,nounits,noheader >> /var/log/gpu-monitoring/gpu-metrics.csv
    fi
    
    # Get container GPU usage if available
    if command -v docker &> /dev/null; then
        docker stats --format "table {{.Container}}\t{{.Name}}\t{{.CPUPerc}}\t{{.MemUsage}}" --no-stream >> /var/log/gpu-monitoring/container-metrics.log
    fi
    
    sleep 30
done
EOF

chmod +x /usr/local/bin/gpu-monitor.sh

# Create systemd service for GPU monitoring
cat > /etc/systemd/system/gpu-monitor.service << 'EOF'
[Unit]
Description=GPU Monitoring Service
After=docker.service
Requires=docker.service

[Service]
Type=simple
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/gpu-monitor.sh
Restart=always
RestartSec=10
User=root

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF

systemctl daemon-reload
systemctl enable gpu-monitor.service
systemctl start gpu-monitor.service

# Create NGC container health check script
cat > /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py << 'EOF'
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
NGC Container Health Check Script
Validates GPU accessibility and container health
"""

import subprocess
import json
import sys
import time
from datetime import datetime

def check_nvidia_smi():
    """Check if nvidia-smi is accessible"""
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(['nvidia-smi', '--query-gpu=name,memory.total,memory.used', '--format=csv,nounits,noheader'], 
                              capture_output=True, text=True, check=True)
        print("âœ… nvidia-smi accessible")
        print("GPU Status:")
        for line in result.stdout.strip().split('\n'):
            if line:
                name, total, used = line.split(', ')
                usage_pct = (float(used) / float(total)) * 100
                print(f"  {name}: {used}MB / {total}MB ({usage_pct:.1f}%)")
        return True
    except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
        print("âŒ nvidia-smi not accessible")
        return False

def check_docker_nvidia():
    """Check if Docker can access NVIDIA GPUs"""
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(['docker', 'run', '--rm', '--gpus', 'all', 'nvidia/cuda:12.2-base-ubuntu20.04', 'nvidia-smi'], 
                              capture_output=True, text=True, check=True, timeout=30)
        print("âœ… Docker GPU access working")
        return True
    except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired):
        print("âŒ Docker GPU access failed")
        return False

def check_ngc_cli():
    """Check NGC CLI functionality"""
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(['ngc', 'registry', 'model', 'list'], 
                              capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=10)
        if result.returncode == 0 or "authentication" in result.stderr.lower():
            print("âœ… NGC CLI accessible (may need authentication)")
            return True
        else:
            print("âŒ NGC CLI not working")
            return False
    except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
        print("âš ï¸ NGC CLI timeout (network issue?)")
        return False
    except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
        print("âŒ NGC CLI not accessible")
        return False

def main():
    """Run all health checks"""
    print(f"ğŸ” NGC Environment Health Check - {datetime.now()}")
    print("=" * 50)
    
    checks = [
        check_nvidia_smi,
        check_docker_nvidia,
        check_ngc_cli
    ]
    
    results = []
    for check in checks:
        try:
            results.append(check())
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"âŒ Check failed: {e}")
            results.append(False)
        print()
    
    success_count = sum(results)
    total_checks = len(results)
    
    print(f"ğŸ“Š Health Check Results: {success_count}/{total_checks} passed")
    
    if success_count == total_checks:
        print("ğŸ‰ All checks passed! NGC environment ready.")
        sys.exit(0)
    else:
        print("âš ï¸ Some checks failed. Review setup.")
        sys.exit(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
EOF

chmod +x /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py

# Create L4-360 specific configuration
cat > /opt/ngc/l4-360-config.json << EOF
{
  "gpu_model": "L4-360",
  "gpu_count": 4,
  "memory_per_gpu": "24GB",
  "recommended_cuda": "12.2",
  "recommended_driver": "535",
  "max_concurrent_containers": 8,
  "monitoring": {
    "gpu_utilization_threshold": 85,
    "memory_threshold": 90,
    "temperature_threshold": 80
  },
  "optimization": {
    "tensor_parallel_size": 2,
    "max_batch_size": 16,
    "context_length": 262144
  }
}
EOF

# Final system configuration
log "Configuring system settings for GPU workloads..."

# Increase shared memory for containers
echo 'vm.max_map_count=262144' >> /etc/sysctl.conf
echo 'kernel.shmmax=68719476736' >> /etc/sysctl.conf
sysctl -p

# Configure log rotation for GPU monitoring
cat > /etc/logrotate.d/gpu-monitoring << 'EOF'
/var/log/gpu-monitoring/*.log /var/log/gpu-monitoring/*.csv {
    daily
    missingok
    rotate 7
    compress
    delaycompress
    notifempty
    sharedscripts
    postrotate
        systemctl reload gpu-monitor.service
    endscript
}
EOF

# Create startup verification script
cat > /opt/ngc/scripts/startup-verification.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Startup Verification for NGC Environment

log_file="/var/log/ngc-startup.log"

log() {
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" | tee -a "$log_file"
}

log "Starting NGC environment verification..."

# Wait for GPU initialization
sleep 10

# Check GPU accessibility
if nvidia-smi > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    log "âœ… GPUs accessible via nvidia-smi"
    nvidia-smi --query-gpu=name,driver_version,memory.total --format=csv >> "$log_file"
else
    log "âŒ GPUs not accessible - driver issue?"
    exit 1
fi

# Check Docker daemon
if systemctl is-active --quiet docker; then
    log "âœ… Docker daemon running"
else
    log "âŒ Docker daemon not running"
    exit 1
fi

# Test Docker GPU access
if docker run --rm --gpus all nvidia/cuda:12.2-base-ubuntu20.04 nvidia-smi > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    log "âœ… Docker GPU passthrough working"
else
    log "âŒ Docker GPU passthrough failed"
    exit 1
fi

log "ğŸ‰ NGC environment verification complete!"
EOF

chmod +x /opt/ngc/scripts/startup-verification.sh

# Add startup verification to crontab
(crontab -l 2>/dev/null; echo "@reboot /opt/ngc/scripts/startup-verification.sh") | crontab -

log "Post-install script completed successfully!"
log "System will require a reboot to ensure all drivers are loaded properly."

# Display summary
echo ""
echo "ğŸ‰ NGC POST-INSTALL COMPLETE!"
echo "=============================="
echo ""
echo "âœ… NVIDIA Driver ${NVIDIA_DRIVER_VERSION} installed"
echo "âœ… CUDA Toolkit ${CUDA_VERSION} installed"
echo "âœ… Docker with NVIDIA Container Toolkit configured"
echo "âœ… NGC CLI v${NGC_CLI_VERSION} installed"
echo "âœ… GPU monitoring service configured"
echo "âœ… Python ML packages installed"
echo "âœ… L4-360 specific configuration created"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“‹ NEXT STEPS:"
echo "1. Reboot the system: sudo reboot"
echo "2. Configure NGC CLI: ngc config set"
echo "3. Run health check: python3 /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py"
echo "4. Start GPU monitoring: systemctl status gpu-monitor"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“ Configuration files:"
echo "  â€¢ L4-360 config: /opt/ngc/l4-360-config.json"
echo "  â€¢ Health check: /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py"
echo "  â€¢ GPU monitoring: /var/log/gpu-monitoring/"
echo ""
echo "âš ï¸  IMPORTANT: Reboot required for driver initialization!"

# Create post-reboot instructions
cat > /opt/ngc/POST_REBOOT_INSTRUCTIONS.md << 'EOF'
# Post-Reboot Setup Instructions

After rebooting your OVH Cloud L4-360 instance:

## 1. Verify Installation
```bash
# Check GPU accessibility
nvidia-smi

# Run comprehensive health check
python3 /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py

# Check services
systemctl status docker
systemctl status gpu-monitor
```

## 2. Configure NGC CLI
```bash
# Set NGC API key (get from https://ngc.nvidia.com/setup/api-key)
ngc config set

# Test NGC access
ngc registry model list
```

## 3. Test Docker GPU Access
```bash
# Test NVIDIA container
docker run --rm --gpus all nvidia/cuda:12.2-base-ubuntu20.04 nvidia-smi

# Test PyTorch container
docker run --rm --gpus all nvcr.io/nvidia/pytorch:23.10-py3 python -c "import torch; print(f'CUDA available: {torch.cuda.is_available()}, Devices: {torch.cuda.device_count()}')"
```

## 4. Deploy Models
Your NGC environment is ready for:
- vLLM model serving with 256K context
- Multi-GPU tensor parallel inference
- Container-based model deployment
- Autoscaling GPU workloads

## 5. Monitoring
- GPU metrics: `/var/log/gpu-monitoring/gpu-metrics.csv`
- Container logs: `docker logs <container_name>`
- System monitoring: `htop`, `nvtop`

Ready for production ML workloads! ğŸš€
EOF

log "Post-reboot instructions created: /opt/ngc/POST_REBOOT_INSTRUCTIONS.md"
log "Installation log: $LOG_FILE"

exit 0

# Install CUDA Toolkit
log "Installing CUDA Toolkit ${CUDA_VERSION}..."
if ! command -v nvcc &> /dev/null; then
    wget https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu2004/x86_64/cuda-keyring_1.0-1_all.deb
    dpkg -i cuda-keyring_1.0-1_all.deb
    apt update -y
    apt install -y cuda-toolkit-12-2
    
    # Set CUDA environment variables
    echo 'export PATH=/usr/local/cuda/bin:$PATH' >> /etc/environment
    echo 'export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH' >> /etc/environment
    echo 'export CUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda' >> /etc/environment
    
    source /etc/environment
else
    log "CUDA already installed: $(nvcc --version | grep release)"
fi

# Install Docker with NVIDIA Container Runtime
log "Installing Docker with NVIDIA Container Runtime..."
if ! command -v docker &> /dev/null; then
    # Install Docker
    curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg
    echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu $(lsb_release -cs) stable" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list
    
    apt update -y
    apt install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin
    
    # Enable Docker service
    systemctl enable docker
    systemctl start docker
    
    # Add current user to docker group (if not root)
    if [[ $SUDO_USER ]]; then
        usermod -aG docker $SUDO_USER
        log "Added $SUDO_USER to docker group"
    fi
else
    log "Docker already installed: $(docker --version)"
fi

# Install NVIDIA Container Toolkit
log "Installing NVIDIA Container Toolkit..."
if ! command -v nvidia-container-runtime &> /dev/null; then
    distribution=$(. /etc/os-release;echo $ID$VERSION_ID) \
        && curl -fsSL https://nvidia.github.io/libnvidia-container/gpgkey | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/nvidia-container-toolkit-keyring.gpg \
        && curl -s -L https://nvidia.github.io/libnvidia-container/$distribution/libnvidia-container.list | \
            sed 's#deb https://#deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/nvidia-container-toolkit-keyring.gpg] https://#g' > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nvidia-container-toolkit.list
    
    apt update -y
    apt install -y nvidia-container-toolkit
    
    # Configure Docker to use NVIDIA runtime
    nvidia-ctk runtime configure --runtime=docker
    systemctl restart docker
else
    log "NVIDIA Container Toolkit already installed"
fi

# Install NGC CLI
log "Installing NGC CLI v${NGC_CLI_VERSION}..."
if ! command -v ngc &> /dev/null; then
    cd /tmp
    wget -O ngccli_linux.zip "https://api.ngc.nvidia.com/v2/resources/nvidia/ngc-apps/ngc_cli/versions/${NGC_CLI_VERSION}/files/ngccli_linux.zip"
    unzip ngccli_linux.zip
    chmod u+x ngc-cli/ngc
    mv ngc-cli/ngc /usr/local/bin/
    rm -rf ngc-cli ngccli_linux.zip
    
    log "NGC CLI installed successfully"
else
    log "NGC CLI already installed: $(ngc version)"
fi

# Configure NGC (requires manual API key setup)
log "NGC CLI installed. Configure with: ngc config set"

# Install additional Python packages for ML workloads
log "Installing Python packages for ML workloads..."
pip3 install --upgrade pip
pip3 install \
    torch \
    torchvision \
    torchaudio \
    transformers \
    accelerate \
    bitsandbytes \
    vllm \
    flash-attn \
    numpy \
    pandas \
    jupyter \
    tensorboard

# Create working directories
log "Creating working directories..."
mkdir -p /opt/ngc/{models,data,logs,scripts}
mkdir -p /var/log/gpu-monitoring
chown -R $SUDO_USER:$SUDO_USER /opt/ngc 2>/dev/null || true

# Install GPU monitoring tools
log "Setting up GPU monitoring tools..."
cat > /usr/local/bin/gpu-monitor.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# GPU Monitoring Script for NGC Containers
while true; do
    timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    
    # Get GPU information
    if command -v nvidia-smi &> /dev/null; then
        nvidia-smi --query-gpu=timestamp,index,name,temperature.gpu,utilization.gpu,memory.used,memory.total,power.draw --format=csv,nounits,noheader >> /var/log/gpu-monitoring/gpu-metrics.csv
    fi
    
    # Get container GPU usage if available
    if command -v docker &> /dev/null; then
        docker stats --format "table {{.Container}}\t{{.Name}}\t{{.CPUPerc}}\t{{.MemUsage}}" --no-stream >> /var/log/gpu-monitoring/container-metrics.log
    fi
    
    sleep 30
done
EOF

chmod +x /usr/local/bin/gpu-monitor.sh

# Create systemd service for GPU monitoring
cat > /etc/systemd/system/gpu-monitor.service << 'EOF'
[Unit]
Description=GPU Monitoring Service
After=docker.service
Requires=docker.service

[Service]
Type=simple
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/gpu-monitor.sh
Restart=always
RestartSec=10
User=root

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF

systemctl daemon-reload
systemctl enable gpu-monitor.service
systemctl start gpu-monitor.service

# Create NGC container health check script
cat > /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py << 'EOF'
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
NGC Container Health Check Script
Validates GPU accessibility and container health
"""

import subprocess
import json
import sys
import time
from datetime import datetime

def check_nvidia_smi():
    """Check if nvidia-smi is accessible"""
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(['nvidia-smi', '--query-gpu=name,memory.total,memory.used', '--format=csv,nounits,noheader'], 
                              capture_output=True, text=True, check=True)
        print("âœ… nvidia-smi accessible")
        print("GPU Status:")
        for line in result.stdout.strip().split('\n'):
            if line:
                name, total, used = line.split(', ')
                usage_pct = (float(used) / float(total)) * 100
                print(f"  {name}: {used}MB / {total}MB ({usage_pct:.1f}%)")
        return True
    except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
        print("âŒ nvidia-smi not accessible")
        return False

def check_docker_nvidia():
    """Check if Docker can access NVIDIA GPUs"""
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(['docker', 'run', '--rm', '--gpus', 'all', 'nvidia/cuda:12.2-base-ubuntu20.04', 'nvidia-smi'], 
                              capture_output=True, text=True, check=True, timeout=30)
        print("âœ… Docker GPU access working")
        return True
    except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired):
        print("âŒ Docker GPU access failed")
        return False

def check_ngc_cli():
    """Check NGC CLI functionality"""
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(['ngc', 'registry', 'model', 'list'], 
                              capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=10)
        if result.returncode == 0 or "authentication" in result.stderr.lower():
            print("âœ… NGC CLI accessible (may need authentication)")
            return True
        else:
            print("âŒ NGC CLI not working")
            return False
    except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
        print("âš ï¸ NGC CLI timeout (network issue?)")
        return False
    except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
        print("âŒ NGC CLI not accessible")
        return False

def main():
    """Run all health checks"""
    print(f"ğŸ” NGC Environment Health Check - {datetime.now()}")
    print("=" * 50)
    
    checks = [
        check_nvidia_smi,
        check_docker_nvidia,
        check_ngc_cli
    ]
    
    results = []
    for check in checks:
        try:
            results.append(check())
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"âŒ Check failed: {e}")
            results.append(False)
        print()
    
    success_count = sum(results)
    total_checks = len(results)
    
    print(f"ğŸ“Š Health Check Results: {success_count}/{total_checks} passed")
    
    if success_count == total_checks:
        print("ğŸ‰ All checks passed! NGC environment ready.")
        sys.exit(0)
    else:
        print("âš ï¸ Some checks failed. Review setup.")
        sys.exit(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
EOF

chmod +x /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py

# Create L4-360 specific configuration
cat > /opt/ngc/l4-360-config.json << EOF
{
  "gpu_model": "L4-360",
  "gpu_count": 4,
  "memory_per_gpu": "24GB",
  "recommended_cuda": "12.2",
  "recommended_driver": "535",
  "max_concurrent_containers": 8,
  "monitoring": {
    "gpu_utilization_threshold": 85,
    "memory_threshold": 90,
    "temperature_threshold": 80
  },
  "optimization": {
    "tensor_parallel_size": 2,
    "max_batch_size": 16,
    "context_length": 262144
  }
}
EOF

# Final system configuration
log "Configuring system settings for GPU workloads..."

# Increase shared memory for containers
echo 'vm.max_map_count=262144' >> /etc/sysctl.conf
echo 'kernel.shmmax=68719476736' >> /etc/sysctl.conf
sysctl -p

# Configure log rotation for GPU monitoring
cat > /etc/logrotate.d/gpu-monitoring << 'EOF'
/var/log/gpu-monitoring/*.log /var/log/gpu-monitoring/*.csv {
    daily
    missingok
    rotate 7
    compress
    delaycompress
    notifempty
    sharedscripts
    postrotate
        systemctl reload gpu-monitor.service
    endscript
}
EOF

# Create startup verification script
cat > /opt/ngc/scripts/startup-verification.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Startup Verification for NGC Environment

log_file="/var/log/ngc-startup.log"

log() {
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" | tee -a "$log_file"
}

log "Starting NGC environment verification..."

# Wait for GPU initialization
sleep 10

# Check GPU accessibility
if nvidia-smi > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    log "âœ… GPUs accessible via nvidia-smi"
    nvidia-smi --query-gpu=name,driver_version,memory.total --format=csv >> "$log_file"
else
    log "âŒ GPUs not accessible - driver issue?"
    exit 1
fi

# Check Docker daemon
if systemctl is-active --quiet docker; then
    log "âœ… Docker daemon running"
else
    log "âŒ Docker daemon not running"
    exit 1
fi

# Test Docker GPU access
if docker run --rm --gpus all nvidia/cuda:12.2-base-ubuntu20.04 nvidia-smi > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    log "âœ… Docker GPU passthrough working"
else
    log "âŒ Docker GPU passthrough failed"
    exit 1
fi

log "ğŸ‰ NGC environment verification complete!"
EOF

chmod +x /opt/ngc/scripts/startup-verification.sh

# Add startup verification to crontab
(crontab -l 2>/dev/null; echo "@reboot /opt/ngc/scripts/startup-verification.sh") | crontab -

log "Post-install script completed successfully!"
log "System will require a reboot to ensure all drivers are loaded properly."

# Display summary
echo ""
echo "ğŸ‰ NGC POST-INSTALL COMPLETE!"
echo "=============================="
echo ""
echo "âœ… NVIDIA Driver ${NVIDIA_DRIVER_VERSION} installed"
echo "âœ… CUDA Toolkit ${CUDA_VERSION} installed"
echo "âœ… Docker with NVIDIA Container Toolkit configured"
echo "âœ… NGC CLI v${NGC_CLI_VERSION} installed"
echo "âœ… GPU monitoring service configured"
echo "âœ… Python ML packages installed"
echo "âœ… L4-360 specific configuration created"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“‹ NEXT STEPS:"
echo "1. Reboot the system: sudo reboot"
echo "2. Configure NGC CLI: ngc config set"
echo "3. Run health check: python3 /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py"
echo "4. Start GPU monitoring: systemctl status gpu-monitor"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“ Configuration files:"
echo "  â€¢ L4-360 config: /opt/ngc/l4-360-config.json"
echo "  â€¢ Health check: /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py"
echo "  â€¢ GPU monitoring: /var/log/gpu-monitoring/"
echo ""
echo "âš ï¸  IMPORTANT: Reboot required for driver initialization!"

# Create post-reboot instructions
cat > /opt/ngc/POST_REBOOT_INSTRUCTIONS.md << 'EOF'
# Post-Reboot Setup Instructions

After rebooting your OVH Cloud L4-360 instance:

## 1. Verify Installation
```bash
# Check GPU accessibility
nvidia-smi

# Run comprehensive health check
python3 /opt/ngc/scripts/health-check.py

# Check services
systemctl status docker
systemctl status gpu-monitor
```

## 2. Configure NGC CLI
```bash
# Set NGC API key (get from https://ngc.nvidia.com/setup/api-key)
ngc config set

# Test NGC access
ngc registry model list
```

## 3. Test Docker GPU Access
```bash
# Test NVIDIA container
docker run --rm --gpus all nvidia/cuda:12.2-base-ubuntu20.04 nvidia-smi

# Test PyTorch container
docker run --rm --gpus all nvcr.io/nvidia/pytorch:23.10-py3 python -c "import torch; print(f'CUDA available: {torch.cuda.is_available()}, Devices: {torch.cuda.device_count()}')"
```

## 4. Deploy Models
Your NGC environment is ready for:
- vLLM model serving with 256K context
- Multi-GPU tensor parallel inference
- Container-based model deployment
- Autoscaling GPU workloads

## 5. Monitoring
- GPU metrics: `/var/log/gpu-monitoring/gpu-metrics.csv`
- Container logs: `docker logs <container_name>`
- System monitoring: `htop`, `nvtop`

Ready for production ML workloads! ğŸš€
EOF

log "Post-reboot instructions created: /opt/ngc/POST_REBOOT_INSTRUCTIONS.md"
log "Installation log: $LOG_FILE"

exit 0

input.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Secure SSH Key Management for OVH Cloud GPU Instances
=====================================================

Automated SSH key generation, rotation, and secure management
for NGC-optimized OVH Cloud L4-360 instances.
"""

import os
import sys
import json
import subprocess
import argparse
import tempfile
import hashlib
import base64
from pathlib import Path
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from typing import Dict, List, Optional, Tuple
from dataclasses import dataclass, asdict
import logging

@dataclass
class SSHKeyInfo:
    """SSH Key information"""
    name: str
    key_type: str
    public_key: str
    fingerprint: str
    created_at: str
    expires_at: Optional[str] = None
    description: str = ""
    is_active: bool = True

@dataclass
class InstanceInfo:
    """OVH Cloud instance information"""
    instance_id: str
    name: str
    ip_address: str
    ssh_port: int = 22
    username: str = "ubuntu"
    key_name: str = ""
    last_accessed: Optional[str] = None

class SSHKeyManager:
    def __init__(self, config_dir: str = "/home/ubuntu/workspace/ovh_deploy/ssh_keys"):
        self.config_dir = Path(config_dir)
        self.config_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
        self.keys_dir = self.config_dir / "keys"
        self.keys_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
        
        self.config_file = self.config_dir / "key_registry.json"
        self.instances_file = self.config_dir / "instances.json"
        
        # Setup logging
        logging.basicConfig(
            level=logging.INFO,
            format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
            handlers=[
                logging.FileHandler(self.config_dir / 'ssh_manager.log'),
                logging.StreamHandler()
            ]
        )
        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
        
        # Load existing configuration
        self.key_registry = self._load_key_registry()
        self.instances = self._load_instances()
    
    def _load_key_registry(self) -> Dict[str, SSHKeyInfo]:
        """Load SSH key registry"""
        if self.config_file.exists():
            try:
                with open(self.config_file, 'r') as f:
                    data = json.load(f)
                return {k: SSHKeyInfo(**v) for k, v in data.items()}
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.warning(f"Failed to load key registry: {e}")
        return {}
    
    def _save_key_registry(self):
        """Save SSH key registry"""
        try:
            data = {k: asdict(v) for k, v in self.key_registry.items()}
            with open(self.config_file, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(data, f, indent=2)
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Failed to save key registry: {e}")
    
    def _load_instances(self) -> Dict[str, InstanceInfo]:
        """Load instance registry"""
        if self.instances_file.exists():
            try:
                with open(self.instances_file, 'r') as f:
                    data = json.load(f)
                return {k: InstanceInfo(**v) for k, v in data.items()}
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.warning(f"Failed to load instances: {e}")
        return {}
    
    def _save_instances(self):
        """Save instance registry"""
        try:
            data = {k: asdict(v) for k, v in self.instances.items()}
            with open(self.instances_file, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(data, f, indent=2)
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Failed to save instances: {e}")
    
    def generate_key_pair(self, 
                         key_name: str, 
                         key_type: str = "ed25519",
                         description: str = "",
                         expires_days: Optional[int] = None) -> Tuple[str, str]:
        """Generate new SSH key pair"""
        
        if key_name in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} already exists")
        
        # Generate key paths
        private_key_path = self.keys_dir / f"{key_name}"
        public_key_path = self.keys_dir / f"{key_name}.pub"
        
        # Generate SSH key pair
        cmd = [
            "ssh-keygen",
            "-t", key_type,
            "-f", str(private_key_path),
            "-N", "",  # No passphrase for automation
            "-C", f"{key_name}@ovh-gpu-instance-{datetime.now().isoformat()}"
        ]
        
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True)
            self.logger.info(f"Generated SSH key pair: {key_name}")
        except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Failed to generate key pair: {e}")
            raise
        
        # Set secure permissions
        os.chmod(private_key_path, 0o600)
        os.chmod(public_key_path, 0o644)
        
        # Read public key
        with open(public_key_path, 'r') as f:
            public_key = f.read().strip()
        
        # Get key fingerprint
        fingerprint = self._get_key_fingerprint(public_key_path)
        
        # Calculate expiry
        expires_at = None
        if expires_days:
            expires_at = (datetime.now() + timedelta(days=expires_days)).isoformat()
        
        # Create key info
        key_info = SSHKeyInfo(
            name=key_name,
            key_type=key_type,
            public_key=public_key,
            fingerprint=fingerprint,
            created_at=datetime.now().isoformat(),
            expires_at=expires_at,
            description=description,
            is_active=True
        )
        
        # Register key
        self.key_registry[key_name] = key_info
        self._save_key_registry()
        
        self.logger.info(f"SSH key {key_name} registered successfully")
        
        return str(private_key_path), str(public_key_path)
    
    def _get_key_fingerprint(self, public_key_path: Path) -> str:
        """Get SSH key fingerprint"""
        try:
            cmd = ["ssh-keygen", "-lf", str(public_key_path)]
            result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True)
            return result.stdout.strip().split()[1]
        except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
            return "unknown"
    
    def get_public_key(self, key_name: str) -> str:
        """Get public key content"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        return self.key_registry[key_name].public_key
    
    def get_private_key_path(self, key_name: str) -> str:
        """Get private key file path"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        private_key_path = self.keys_dir / key_name
        if not private_key_path.exists():
            raise FileNotFoundError(f"Private key file not found: {private_key_path}")
        
        return str(private_key_path)
    
    def list_keys(self) -> List[SSHKeyInfo]:
        """List all registered SSH keys"""
        return list(self.key_registry.values())
    
    def deactivate_key(self, key_name: str):
        """Deactivate SSH key"""
        if key_name in self.key_registry:
            self.key_registry[key_name].is_active = False
            self._save_key_registry()
            self.logger.info(f"Deactivated SSH key: {key_name}")
        else:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
    
    def rotate_key(self, key_name: str, new_key_name: Optional[str] = None) -> str:
        """Rotate SSH key (create new, deactivate old)"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        old_key = self.key_registry[key_name]
        
        # Generate new key name if not provided
        if not new_key_name:
            timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
            new_key_name = f"{key_name}_rotated_{timestamp}"
        
        # Generate new key pair
        private_key_path, public_key_path = self.generate_key_pair(
            new_key_name,
            old_key.key_type,
            f"Rotated from {key_name}",
            expires_days=90  # 90-day rotation cycle
        )
        
        # Deactivate old key
        self.deactivate_key(key_name)
        
        self.logger.info(f"Rotated SSH key: {key_name} -> {new_key_name}")
        
        return new_key_name
    
    def add_instance(self, 
                    instance_id: str,
                    name: str, 
                    ip_address: str,
                    username: str = "ubuntu",
                    ssh_port: int = 22,
                    key_name: str = "") -> InstanceInfo:
        """Add OVH Cloud instance to registry"""
        
        instance = InstanceInfo(
            instance_id=instance_id,
            name=name,
            ip_address=ip_address,
            ssh_port=ssh_port,
            username=username,
            key_name=key_name
        )
        
        self.instances[instance_id] = instance
        self._save_instances()
        
        self.logger.info(f"Added instance: {name} ({ip_address})")
        
        return instance
    
    def deploy_key_to_instance(self, key_name: str, instance_id: str) -> bool:
        """Deploy SSH key to OVH Cloud instance"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        if instance_id not in self.instances:
            raise ValueError(f"Instance {instance_id} not found")
        
        key_info = self.key_registry[key_name]
        instance = self.instances[instance_id]
        
        if not key_info.is_active:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} is not active")
        
        try:
            # Create temporary public key file
            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode='w', suffix='.pub', delete=False) as temp_key:
                temp_key.write(key_info.public_key)
                temp_key_path = temp_key.name
            
            # Deploy key using ssh-copy-id
            cmd = [
                "ssh-copy-id",
                "-i", temp_key_path,
                "-p", str(instance.ssh_port),
                f"{instance.username}@{instance.ip_address}"
            ]
            
            result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True)
            
            # Clean up temporary file
            os.unlink(temp_key_path)
            
            if result.returncode == 0:
                # Update instance record
                self.instances[instance_id].key_name = key_name
                self.instances[instance_id].last_accessed = datetime.now().isoformat()
                self._save_instances()
                
                self.logger.info(f"Deployed key {key_name} to instance {instance.name}")
                return True
            else:
                self.logger.error(f"Failed to deploy key: {result.stderr}")
                return False
                
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Error deploying key: {e}")
            return False
    
    def test_connection(self, instance_id: str, key_name: Optional[str] = None) -> bool:
        """Test SSH connection to instance"""
        if instance_id not in self.instances:
            raise ValueError(f"Instance {instance_id} not found")
        
        instance = self.instances[instance_id]
        
        # Use specified key or instance's assigned key
        test_key = key_name or instance.key_name
        if not test_key:
            raise ValueError("No SSH key specified for testing")
        
        if test_key not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {test_key} not found")
        
        private_key_path = self.get_private_key_path(test_key)
        
        # Test SSH connection
        cmd = [
            "ssh",
            "-i", private_key_path,
            "-p", str(instance.ssh_port),
            "-o", "ConnectTimeout=10",
            "-o", "BatchMode=yes",
            "-o", "StrictHostKeyChecking=no",
            f"{instance.username}@{instance.ip_address}",
            "echo 'SSH connection successful'"
        ]
        
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=15)
            
            if result.returncode == 0:
                # Update last accessed time
                self.instances[instance_id].last_accessed = datetime.now().isoformat()
                self._save_instances()
                
                self.logger.info(f"SSH connection test successful: {instance.name}")
                return True
            else:
                self.logger.warning(f"SSH connection test failed: {result.stderr}")
                return False
                
        except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
            self.logger.warning(f"SSH connection test timeout: {instance.name}")
            return False
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"SSH connection test error: {e}")
            return False
    
    def cleanup_expired_keys(self) -> List[str]:
        """Clean up expired SSH keys"""
        expired_keys = []
        now = datetime.now()
        
        for key_name, key_info in self.key_registry.items():
            if key_info.expires_at:
                expires = datetime.fromisoformat(key_info.expires_at)
                if now > expires:
                    self.deactivate_key(key_name)
                    expired_keys.append(key_name)
        
        if expired_keys:
            self.logger.info(f"Deactivated expired keys: {expired_keys}")
        
        return expired_keys
    
    def generate_ovh_cloud_script(self, key_name: str) -> str:
        """Generate OVH Cloud deployment script"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        key_info = self.key_registry[key_name]
        public_key = key_info.public_key
        
        script_content = f'''#!/bin/bash
# OVH Cloud L4-360 Instance Deployment Script
# Generated: {datetime.now().isoformat()}
# SSH Key: {key_name}

set -euo pipefail

echo "ğŸš€ Starting OVH Cloud L4-360 deployment..."

# Install SSH key
echo "ğŸ“ Installing SSH key..."
mkdir -p ~/.ssh
chmod 700 ~/.ssh

cat >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys << 'EOF'
{public_key}
EOF

chmod 600 ~/.ssh/authorized_keys

echo "âœ… SSH key installed successfully"

# Download and run NGC post-install script
echo "ğŸ“¦ Running NGC post-install script..."
wget -O /tmp/ngc_post_install.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/your-repo/ovh_deploy/main/ngc_post_install.sh
chmod +x /tmp/ngc_post_install.sh
sudo /tmp/ngc_post_install.sh

echo "ğŸ‰ OVH Cloud L4-360 deployment complete!"
echo "SSH Key: {key_name}"
echo "Fingerprint: {key_info.fingerprint}"
echo "Ready for NGC workloads!"
'''
        
        # Save deployment script
        script_path = self.config_dir / f"deploy_{key_name}.sh"
        with open(script_path, 'w') as f:
            f.write(script_content)
        
        os.chmod(script_path, 0o755)
        
        self.logger.info(f"Generated deployment script: {script_path}")
        
        return str(script_path)

def main():
    """CLI interface for SSH key manager"""
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="SSH Key Manager for OVH Cloud GPU Instances")
    subparsers = parser.add_subparsers(dest='command', help='Available commands')
    
    # Generate key command
    gen_parser = subparsers.add_parser('generate', help='Generate new SSH key pair')
    gen_parser.add_argument('name', help='Key name')
    gen_parser.add_argument('--type', default='ed25519', help='Key type (default: ed25519)')
    gen_parser.add_argument('--description', default='', help='Key description')
    gen_parser.add_argument('--expires', type=int, help='Expiry in days')
    
    # List keys command
    list_parser = subparsers.add_parser('list', help='List all SSH keys')
    
    # Add instance command
    instance_parser = subparsers.add_parser('add-instance', help='Add OVH Cloud instance')
    instance_parser.add_argument('instance_id', help='Instance ID')
    instance_parser.add_argument('name', help='Instance name')
    instance_parser.add_argument('ip_address', help='IP address')
    instance_parser.add_argument('--username', default='ubuntu', help='SSH username')
    instance_parser.add_argument('--port', type=int, default=22, help='SSH port')
    
    # Deploy key command
    deploy_parser = subparsers.add_parser('deploy', help='Deploy SSH key to instance')
    deploy_parser.add_argument('key_name', help='Key name')
    deploy_parser.add_argument('instance_id', help='Instance ID')
    
    # Test connection command
    test_parser = subparsers.add_parser('test', help='Test SSH connection')
    test_parser.add_argument('instance_id', help='Instance ID')
    test_parser.add_argument('--key', help='Key name (optional)')
    
    # Generate script command
    script_parser = subparsers.add_parser('script', help='Generate OVH deployment script')
    script_parser.add_argument('key_name', help='Key name')
    
    # Rotate key command
    rotate_parser = subparsers.add_parser('rotate', help='Rotate SSH key')
    rotate_parser.add_argument('key_name', help='Key name to rotate')
    rotate_parser.add_argument('--new-name', help='New key name (optional)')
    
    # Cleanup command
    cleanup_parser = subparsers.add_parser('cleanup', help='Clean up expired keys')
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    if not args.command:
        parser.print_help()
        sys.exit(1)
    
    manager = SSHKeyManager()
    
    try:
        if args.command == 'generate':
            private_key, public_key = manager.generate_key_pair(
                args.name, args.type, args.description, args.expires
            )
            print(f"âœ… Generated SSH key pair: {args.name}")
            print(f"Private key: {private_key}")
            print(f"Public key: {public_key}")
            
        elif args.command == 'list':
            keys = manager.list_keys()
            print(f"ğŸ“‹ SSH Keys ({len(keys)} total):")
            print("-" * 80)
            for key in keys:
                status = "âœ… Active" if key.is_active else "âŒ Inactive"
                expires = key.expires_at or "Never"
                print(f"{key.name:20} {key.key_type:8} {status:12} Expires: {expires}")
                if key.description:
                    print(f"{'':20} Description: {key.description}")
                print(f"{'':20} Fingerprint: {key.fingerprint}")
                print()
                
        elif args.command == 'add-instance':
            instance = manager.add_instance(
                args.instance_id, args.name, args.ip_address, args.username, args.port
            )
            print(f"âœ… Added instance: {instance.name} ({instance.ip_address})")
            
        elif args.command == 'deploy':
            success = manager.deploy_key_to_instance(args.key_name, args.instance_id)
            if success:
                print(f"âœ… Deployed key {args.key_name} to instance {args.instance_id}")
            else:
                print(f"âŒ Failed to deploy key")
                sys.exit(1)
                
        elif args.command == 'test':
            success = manager.test_connection(args.instance_id, args.key)
            if success:
                print(f"âœ… SSH connection successful")
            else:
                print(f"âŒ SSH connection failed")
                sys.exit(1)
                
        elif args.command == 'script':
            script_path = manager.generate_ovh_cloud_script(args.key_name)
            print(f"âœ… Generated deployment script: {script_path}")
            
        elif args.command == 'rotate':
            new_key_name = manager.rotate_key(args.key_name, args.new_name)
            print(f"âœ… Rotated key: {args.key_name} -> {new_key_name}")
            
        elif args.command == 'cleanup':
            expired = manager.cleanup_expired_keys()
            if expired:
                print(f"âœ… Cleaned up {len(expired)} expired keys: {expired}")
            else:
                print("âœ… No expired keys found")
                
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"âŒ Error: {e}")
        sys.exit(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Secure SSH Key Management for OVH Cloud GPU Instances
=====================================================

Automated SSH key generation, rotation, and secure management
for NGC-optimized OVH Cloud L4-360 instances.
"""

import os
import sys
import json
import subprocess
import argparse
import tempfile
import hashlib
import base64
from pathlib import Path
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from typing import Dict, List, Optional, Tuple
from dataclasses import dataclass, asdict
import logging

@dataclass
class SSHKeyInfo:
    """SSH Key information"""
    name: str
    key_type: str
    public_key: str
    fingerprint: str
    created_at: str
    expires_at: Optional[str] = None
    description: str = ""
    is_active: bool = True

@dataclass
class InstanceInfo:
    """OVH Cloud instance information"""
    instance_id: str
    name: str
    ip_address: str
    ssh_port: int = 22
    username: str = "ubuntu"
    key_name: str = ""
    last_accessed: Optional[str] = None

class SSHKeyManager:
    def __init__(self, config_dir: str = "/home/ubuntu/workspace/ovh_deploy/ssh_keys"):
        self.config_dir = Path(config_dir)
        self.config_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
        self.keys_dir = self.config_dir / "keys"
        self.keys_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
        
        self.config_file = self.config_dir / "key_registry.json"
        self.instances_file = self.config_dir / "instances.json"
        
        # Setup logging
        logging.basicConfig(
            level=logging.INFO,
            format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
            handlers=[
                logging.FileHandler(self.config_dir / 'ssh_manager.log'),
                logging.StreamHandler()
            ]
        )
        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
        
        # Load existing configuration
        self.key_registry = self._load_key_registry()
        self.instances = self._load_instances()
    
    def _load_key_registry(self) -> Dict[str, SSHKeyInfo]:
        """Load SSH key registry"""
        if self.config_file.exists():
            try:
                with open(self.config_file, 'r') as f:
                    data = json.load(f)
                return {k: SSHKeyInfo(**v) for k, v in data.items()}
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.warning(f"Failed to load key registry: {e}")
        return {}
    
    def _save_key_registry(self):
        """Save SSH key registry"""
        try:
            data = {k: asdict(v) for k, v in self.key_registry.items()}
            with open(self.config_file, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(data, f, indent=2)
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Failed to save key registry: {e}")
    
    def _load_instances(self) -> Dict[str, InstanceInfo]:
        """Load instance registry"""
        if self.instances_file.exists():
            try:
                with open(self.instances_file, 'r') as f:
                    data = json.load(f)
                return {k: InstanceInfo(**v) for k, v in data.items()}
            except Exception as e:
                self.logger.warning(f"Failed to load instances: {e}")
        return {}
    
    def _save_instances(self):
        """Save instance registry"""
        try:
            data = {k: asdict(v) for k, v in self.instances.items()}
            with open(self.instances_file, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(data, f, indent=2)
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Failed to save instances: {e}")
    
    def generate_key_pair(self, 
                         key_name: str, 
                         key_type: str = "ed25519",
                         description: str = "",
                         expires_days: Optional[int] = None) -> Tuple[str, str]:
        """Generate new SSH key pair"""
        
        if key_name in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} already exists")
        
        # Generate key paths
        private_key_path = self.keys_dir / f"{key_name}"
        public_key_path = self.keys_dir / f"{key_name}.pub"
        
        # Generate SSH key pair
        cmd = [
            "ssh-keygen",
            "-t", key_type,
            "-f", str(private_key_path),
            "-N", "",  # No passphrase for automation
            "-C", f"{key_name}@ovh-gpu-instance-{datetime.now().isoformat()}"
        ]
        
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True)
            self.logger.info(f"Generated SSH key pair: {key_name}")
        except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Failed to generate key pair: {e}")
            raise
        
        # Set secure permissions
        os.chmod(private_key_path, 0o600)
        os.chmod(public_key_path, 0o644)
        
        # Read public key
        with open(public_key_path, 'r') as f:
            public_key = f.read().strip()
        
        # Get key fingerprint
        fingerprint = self._get_key_fingerprint(public_key_path)
        
        # Calculate expiry
        expires_at = None
        if expires_days:
            expires_at = (datetime.now() + timedelta(days=expires_days)).isoformat()
        
        # Create key info
        key_info = SSHKeyInfo(
            name=key_name,
            key_type=key_type,
            public_key=public_key,
            fingerprint=fingerprint,
            created_at=datetime.now().isoformat(),
            expires_at=expires_at,
            description=description,
            is_active=True
        )
        
        # Register key
        self.key_registry[key_name] = key_info
        self._save_key_registry()
        
        self.logger.info(f"SSH key {key_name} registered successfully")
        
        return str(private_key_path), str(public_key_path)
    
    def _get_key_fingerprint(self, public_key_path: Path) -> str:
        """Get SSH key fingerprint"""
        try:
            cmd = ["ssh-keygen", "-lf", str(public_key_path)]
            result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True)
            return result.stdout.strip().split()[1]
        except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
            return "unknown"
    
    def get_public_key(self, key_name: str) -> str:
        """Get public key content"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        return self.key_registry[key_name].public_key
    
    def get_private_key_path(self, key_name: str) -> str:
        """Get private key file path"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        private_key_path = self.keys_dir / key_name
        if not private_key_path.exists():
            raise FileNotFoundError(f"Private key file not found: {private_key_path}")
        
        return str(private_key_path)
    
    def list_keys(self) -> List[SSHKeyInfo]:
        """List all registered SSH keys"""
        return list(self.key_registry.values())
    
    def deactivate_key(self, key_name: str):
        """Deactivate SSH key"""
        if key_name in self.key_registry:
            self.key_registry[key_name].is_active = False
            self._save_key_registry()
            self.logger.info(f"Deactivated SSH key: {key_name}")
        else:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
    
    def rotate_key(self, key_name: str, new_key_name: Optional[str] = None) -> str:
        """Rotate SSH key (create new, deactivate old)"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        old_key = self.key_registry[key_name]
        
        # Generate new key name if not provided
        if not new_key_name:
            timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
            new_key_name = f"{key_name}_rotated_{timestamp}"
        
        # Generate new key pair
        private_key_path, public_key_path = self.generate_key_pair(
            new_key_name,
            old_key.key_type,
            f"Rotated from {key_name}",
            expires_days=90  # 90-day rotation cycle
        )
        
        # Deactivate old key
        self.deactivate_key(key_name)
        
        self.logger.info(f"Rotated SSH key: {key_name} -> {new_key_name}")
        
        return new_key_name
    
    def add_instance(self, 
                    instance_id: str,
                    name: str, 
                    ip_address: str,
                    username: str = "ubuntu",
                    ssh_port: int = 22,
                    key_name: str = "") -> InstanceInfo:
        """Add OVH Cloud instance to registry"""
        
        instance = InstanceInfo(
            instance_id=instance_id,
            name=name,
            ip_address=ip_address,
            ssh_port=ssh_port,
            username=username,
            key_name=key_name
        )
        
        self.instances[instance_id] = instance
        self._save_instances()
        
        self.logger.info(f"Added instance: {name} ({ip_address})")
        
        return instance
    
    def deploy_key_to_instance(self, key_name: str, instance_id: str) -> bool:
        """Deploy SSH key to OVH Cloud instance"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")
        
        if instance_id not in self.instances:
            raise ValueError(f"Instance {instance_id} not found")
        
        key_info = self.key_registry[key_name]
        instance = self.instances[instance_id]
        
        if not key_info.is_active:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} is not active")
        
        try:
            # Create temporary public key file
            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode='w', suffix='.pub', delete=False) as temp_key:
                temp_key.write(key_info.public_key)

            # Deploy key using ssh-copy-id
            cmd = [
                "ssh-copy-id",
                "-i", temp_key_path,
                "-p", str(instance.ssh_port),
                f"{instance.username}@{instance.ip_address}"
            ]
            
            result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True)
            
            # Clean up temporary file
            os.unlink(temp_key_path)
            
            if result.returncode == 0:
                # Update instance record
                self.instances[instance_id].key_name = key_name
                self.instances[instance_id].last_accessed = datetime.now().isoformat()
                self._save_instances()
                
                self.logger.info(f"Deployed key {key_name} to instance {instance.name}")
                return True
            else:
                self.logger.error(f"Failed to deploy key: {result.stderr}")
                return False
                
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"Error deploying key: {e}")
            return False
    
    def test_connection(self, instance_id: str, key_name: Optional[str] = None) -> bool:

        ]
        
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=15)
            
            if result.returncode == 0:
                # Update last accessed time
                self.instances[instance_id].last_accessed = datetime.now().isoformat()
                self._save_instances()
                
                self.logger.info(f"SSH connection test successful: {instance.name}")
                return True
            else:
                self.logger.warning(f"SSH connection test failed: {result.stderr}")
                return False
                
        except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
            self.logger.warning(f"SSH connection test timeout: {instance.name}")
            return False
        except Exception as e:
            self.logger.error(f"SSH connection test error: {e}")
            return False
    
    def cleanup_expired_keys(self) -> List[str]:
        """Clean up expired SSH keys"""
        expired_keys = []
        now = datetime.now()
        
        for key_name, key_info in self.key_registry.items():
            if key_info.expires_at:
                expires = datetime.fromisoformat(key_info.expires_at)
                if now > expires:
                    self.deactivate_key(key_name)
                    expired_keys.append(key_name)
        
        if expired_keys:
            self.logger.info(f"Deactivated expired keys: {expired_keys}")
        
        return expired_keys
    
    def generate_ovh_cloud_script(self, key_name: str) -> str:
        """Generate OVH Cloud deployment script"""
        if key_name not in self.key_registry:
            raise ValueError(f"Key {key_name} not found")

set -euo pipefail

echo "ğŸš€ Starting OVH Cloud L4-360 deployment..."

# Install SSH key
echo "ğŸ“ Installing SSH key..."
mkdir -p ~/.ssh

EOF

chmod 600 ~/.ssh/authorized_keys

echo "âœ… SSH key installed successfully"

echo "ğŸ“¦ Running NGC post-install script..."
wget -O /tmp/ngc_post_install.sh https://raw.githubusercontent.com/your-repo/ovh_deploy/main/ngc_post_install.sh
chmod +x /tmp/ngc_post_install.sh
sudo /tmp/ngc_post_install.sh

echo "ğŸ‰ OVH Cloud L4-360 deployment complete!"
echo "SSH Key: {key_name}"
echo "Fingerprint: {key_info.fingerprint}"
echo "Ready for NGC workloads!"
'''
        
        # Save deployment script
        script_path = self.config_dir / f"deploy_{key_name}.sh"
        with open(script_path, 'w') as f:
            f.write(script_content)
        
        os.chmod(script_path, 0o755)
        
        self.logger.info(f"Generated deployment script: {script_path}")
        
        return str(script_path)

def main():
    """CLI interface for SSH key manager"""
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="SSH Key Manager for OVH Cloud GPU Instances")
    subparsers = parser.add_subparsers(dest='command', help='Available commands')
    
    # Generate key command
    gen_parser = subparsers.add_parser('generate', help='Generate new SSH key pair')
    gen_parser.add_argument('name', help='Key name')
    gen_parser.add_argument('--type', default='ed25519', help='Key type (default: ed25519)')
    gen_parser.add_argument('--description', default='', help='Key description')
    gen_parser.add_argument('--expires', type=int, help='Expiry in days')
    
    # List keys command
    list_parser = subparsers.add_parser('list', help='List all SSH keys')
    
    # Add instance command
    instance_parser = subparsers.add_parser('add-instance', help='Add OVH Cloud instance')
    instance_parser.add_argument('instance_id', help='Instance ID')
    instance_parser.add_argument('name', help='Instance name')
    instance_parser.add_argument('ip_address', help='IP address')
    instance_parser.add_argument('--username', default='ubuntu', help='SSH username')
    instance_parser.add_argument('--port', type=int, default=22, help='SSH port')
    
    # Deploy key command
    deploy_parser = subparsers.add_parser('deploy', help='Deploy SSH key to instance')
    deploy_parser.add_argument('key_name', help='Key name')
    deploy_parser.add_argument('instance_id', help='Instance ID')
    
    # Test connection command
    test_parser = subparsers.add_parser('test', help='Test SSH connection')
    test_parser.add_argument('instance_id', help='Instance ID')
    test_parser.add_argument('--key', help='Key name (optional)')
    
    # Generate script command
    script_parser = subparsers.add_parser('script', help='Generate OVH deployment script')
    script_parser.add_argument('key_name', help='Key name')
    
    # Rotate key command
    rotate_parser = subparsers.add_parser('rotate', help='Rotate SSH key')
    rotate_parser.add_argument('key_name', help='Key name to rotate')
    rotate_parser.add_argument('--new-name', help='New key name (optional)')
    
    # Cleanup command
    cleanup_parser = subparsers.add_parser('cleanup', help='Clean up expired keys')
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    if not args.command:
        parser.print_help()
        sys.exit(1)
    
    manager = SSHKeyManager()
    
    try:
        if args.command == 'generate':
            private_key, public_key = manager.generate_key_pair(
                args.name, args.type, args.description, args.expires
            )
            print(f"âœ… Generated SSH key pair: {args.name}")
            print(f"Private key: {private_key}")
            print(f"Public key: {public_key}")
            
        elif args.command == 'list':
            keys = manager.list_keys()
            print(f"ğŸ“‹ SSH Keys ({len(keys)} total):")
            print("-" * 80)
            for key in keys:
                status = "âœ… Active" if key.is_active else "âŒ Inactive"
                expires = key.expires_at or "Never"
                print(f"{key.name:20} {key.key_type:8} {status:12} Expires: {expires}")
                if key.description:
                    print(f"{'':20} Description: {key.description}")
                print(f"{'':20} Fingerprint: {key.fingerprint}")
                print()
                
        elif args.command == 'add-instance':
            instance = manager.add_instance(
                args.instance_id, args.name, args.ip_address, args.username, args.port
            )
            print(f"âœ… Added instance: {instance.name} ({instance.ip_address})")
            
        elif args.command == 'deploy':
            success = manager.deploy_key_to_instance(args.key_name, args.instance_id)
            if success:
                print(f"âœ… Deployed key {args.key_name} to instance {args.instance_id}")
            else:
                print(f"âŒ Failed to deploy key")
                sys.exit(1)
                
        elif args.command == 'test':
            success = manager.test_connection(args.instance_id, args.key)
            if success:
                print(f"âœ… SSH connection successful")
            else:
                print(f"âŒ SSH connection failed")
                sys.exit(1)
                
        elif args.command == 'script':
            script_path = manager.generate_ovh_cloud_script(args.key_name)
            print(f"âœ… Generated deployment script: {script_path}")
            
        elif args.command == 'rotate':
            new_key_name = manager.rotate_key(args.key_name, args.new_name)
            print(f"âœ… Rotated key: {args.key_name} -> {new_key_name}")
            
        elif args.command == 'cleanup':
            expired = manager.cleanup_expired_keys()
            if expired:
                print(f"âœ… Cleaned up {len(expired)} expired keys: {expired}")
            else:
                print("âœ… No expired keys found")
                
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"âŒ Error: {e}")
        sys.exit(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
